text: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more. If you look at what you don't have in life, you'll never have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The purpose of our lives is to be happy and to add value to the world.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Spread love everywhere you go. Let no one ever come to you without leaving happier.
author: Mother Teresa

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
author: Margaret Mead

text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
author: Helen Keller

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
author: Anne Frank

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: There's some good in this world and it's worth fighting for.
author: Samwise Gamgee
source: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers (2002)

text: After all, tomorrow is another day!
author: Scarlett O'Hara

text: I'm going to make him an offer he can't refuse.
author: Vito Corleone

text: You can't handle the truth!
author: Colonel Nathan Jessup

text: Here's looking at you, kid.
author: Rick Blaine

text: May the Force be with you.
author: Han Solo

text: I'll be back.
author: The Terminator

text: Why so serious?
author: The Joker

text: You is kind. You is smart. You is important.
author: Aibileen Clark

text: The greatest trick the Devil ever pulled was convincing the world he didn't exist.
author: Verbal Kint

text: Show me the money!
author: Rod Tidwell

text: Houston, we have a problem.
author: Jack Swigert

text: I wish I could go back to then. To choose not to take that shortcut.
author: Andy Dufresne

text: To infinity and beyond!
author: Buzz Lightyear

text: I am your father.
author: Darth Vader

text: You talking to me?
author: Travis Bickle

text: Everything you want is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: The only way out is through.
author: Robert Frost

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Call me Ishmael.
author: Ishmael

text: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

text: All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: It was love at first sight. The first time Yossarian saw the chaplain, he fell madly in love with him.
author: Joseph Heller

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: Ask not what your country can do for you – ask what you can do for your country.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: I have a dream that my four little children will one day live in a nation where they will not be judged by the color of their skin but by the content of their character.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The greatest wealth is health.
author: Virgil

text: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

text: Suffering is not inevitable when embraced with wisdom and compassion.
author: Various

text: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
author: Aesop

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: The only thing constant in life is change.
author: Heraclitus

text: Cogito, ergo sum.
author: René Descartes

text: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

text: The pen is mightier than the sword.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: The early bird catches the worm.
author: Proverb

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: To be, or not to be, that is the question.
author: William Shakespeare

text: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Something is rotten in the state of Denmark.
author: William Shakespeare

text: What a wonderful world this could be.
author: Louis Armstrong

text: Imagine all the people living life in peace.
author: John Lennon

text: I've paid my dues, time after time.
author: Freddie Mercury

text: Life is like a box of chocolates, you never know what you're gonna get.
author: Forrest Gump

text: Just keep swimming.
author: Dory

text: The lion sleeps tonight.
author: The Lion Sleeps Tonight

text: I want to break free.
author: Queen

text: Don't stop me now, I'm having such a good time.
author: Freddie Mercury

text: One does not simply walk into Mordor.
author: Boromir
source: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (2001)

text: Winter is coming.
author: House Stark

text: That's what I love about these high school girls, man. I get older, they stay the same age.
author: Wooderson

text: You can't just ask people why they're white, Karen!
author: Damian Leigh

text: That's hot.
author: Paris Hilton

text: I'm not superstitious, but I am a little stitious.
author: Michael Scott

text: Bears. Beets. Battlestar Galactica.
author: Jim Halpert

text: How you doin'?
author: Joey Tribbiani

text: We were on a break!
author: Ross Geller

text: Could I BE any more sarcastic?
author: Chandler Bing

text: Yippee-ki-yay, motherf***er.
author: John McClane

text: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.
author: Rhett Butler

text: Here's Johnny!
author: Jack Torrance

text: The truth is out there.
author: FBI Slogan

text: That which does not kill me makes me stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.
author: Edmund Hillary

text: Go big or go home.
author: Sports Mantra

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: I'm Batman.
author: Bruce Wayne

text: With great power comes great responsibility.
author: Uncle Ben

text: I'll have what she's having.
author: Old Lady

text: The stuff that dreams are made of.
author: Sam Spade

text: Carpe diem. Seize the day, boys.
author: John Keating

text: Mrs. Robinson, you're trying to seduce me.
author: Benjamin Braddock

text: They call it a Royale with Cheese.
author: Vincent Vega

text: The most dangerous game is love.
author: Various

text: The road not taken.
author: Robert Frost

text: Do or do not. There is no try.
author: Yoda

text: I am legend.
author: Robert Neville

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
author: Helen Keller

text: The greatest happiness you can have is knowing that you do not necessarily require happiness.
author: William Saroyan

text: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
author: Maya Angelou
source: I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings

text: We cannot live only for ourselves. A thousand fibers connect us with our fellow men and women; and among those fibers, as sympathetic threads, we feel every act and word.
author: Herman Melville

text: To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The cave you fear to enter holds the treasure you seek.
author: Joseph Campbell

text: You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the entire ocean in a drop.
author: Rumi

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never failing, but in rising every time we fail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: The day you stop racing is the day you win the race.
author: Bob Marley

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Sometimes it falls upon a generation to be great. You can be that great generation.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Beauty is not about having a perfect body. It is about having a perfect attitude.
author: Various

text: The cure for anything is salt water: sweat, tears, or the sea.
author: Isak Dinesen

text: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, but today is a gift. That is why it is called the present.
author: Bill Keane

text: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
author: Maya Angelou

text: We are dying from overthinking. We are slowly killing ourselves by drowning in our thoughts.
author: Warsan Shire

text: Everything we want is just outside our comfort zone.
author: Robert Allen

text: You don't have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The only prison people live in is the fear of what other people think.
author: Bill Murray

text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddha

text: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Stop trying to make everyone else happy and focus on making yourself a better person.
author: Various

text: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
author: Rumi

text: A person is not finished when they are defeated. They are finished when they quit.
author: Richard Nixon

text: The only limits that really matter are the ones we accept in our minds.
author: Various

text: We are made of stardust, and the atoms in our bodies are as old as the universe itself.
author: Carl Sagan

text: Do what you feel in your heart to be right. For you'll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Your purpose in life is not just to be happy. It is to be happy, and to make a difference.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The person who says it cannot be done should not interrupt the person doing it.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: In every moment of doubt, ask yourself: Who am I becoming?
author: Various

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart.
author: Albert Camus

text: We accept the love we think we deserve.
author: Stephen Chbosky
source: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

text: Remember that you are not alone in whatever you do. Life is a journey, not a destination.

text: Man is condemned to be free.

text: History is written by the victors.

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Hell is other people.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: We are what we repeatedly do.
author: Aristotle

text: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Cicero

text: All models are wrong, but some are useful.

text: The medium is the message.
author: Marshall McLuhan

text: Those who control the present control the past.
author: George Orwell

text: One cannot step twice into the same river.
author: Heraclitus

text: Madness is rare in individuals—but common in groups.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The limits of my language mean the limits of my world.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

text: Power tends to corrupt.
author: Lord Acton

text: Man is born free, and everywhere he is in chains.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: The only thing necessary for evil to triumph is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

text: Time is an illusion.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: The greatest tyranny is the tyranny of the majority.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

text: We live as we dream—alone.
author: Joseph Conrad

text: The past is never dead. It's not even past.
author: William Faulkner

text: What we know is a drop, what we don't know is an ocean.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Man makes plans, and God laughs.
author: Jiddish Proverb

text: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.

text: The map is not the territory.

author: Oscar Wilde

text: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.

author: Proverb

text: Time is money.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The pen is mightier than the sword.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

text: Fortune favors the bold.
author: Virgil

text: No pain, no gain.
author: Proverb

text: The early bird catches the worm.
author: Proverb

text: Actions speak louder than words.

text: If you want peace, prepare for war.
author: Vegetius

text: The truth will set you free.
author: Bible

text: What goes around comes around.

text: Power corrupts; absolute power corrupts absolutely.

text: Less is more.

author: Proverb

text: Hope is a good thing.

text: Every journey begins with a single step.
author: Laozi

text: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: The owl of Minerva spreads its wings only with the falling of the dusk.

text: Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun.
author: Alan Watts

text: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four.
author: George Orwell

text: The brave man is he who overcomes not only his enemies but his pleasures.
author: Democritus

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: Man is something that shall be overcome.

text: The greatest enemy of knowledge is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find meaning in the suffering.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

text: You cannot find peace by avoiding life.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: It is not the strongest of the species that survives.
author: Charles Darwin

text: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The opposite of love is not hate, but indifference.
author: Elie Wiesel

text: We do not remember days, we remember moments.
author: Cesare Pavese

text: One must imagine Sisyphus happy.
author: Albert Camus

text: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The eye sees only what the mind is prepared to comprehend.
author: Henri Bergson

text: Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
author: Woody Allen

text: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.
author: Malcolm X

text: Between stimulus and response there is a space.
author: Viktor Frankl

text: What is history but a fable agreed upon?
author: Napoleon Bonaparte
